titleStmt.title: The tryall and condemnation of Col. Adrian Scrope, Mr. John Carew, Mr. Thomas Scott, Mr. Gregory Clement, Col. John Jones, who sate as judges upon our late Soveraigne Lord King Charles their several answers and pleas at the Sessions-House in the Old-Baily, Friday the 12th of October 1660, before the Commissioners of Oyer and Terminer appointed by His Majesty for that purpose.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A63139 of text R17315 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing T2137). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 13 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 5 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1641-1700 ; 677:9)

titleStmt.title: The tryall and condemnation of Col. Adrian Scrope, Mr. John Carew, Mr. Thomas Scott, Mr. Gregory Clement, Col. John Jones, who sate as judges upon our late Soveraigne Lord King Charles their several answers and pleas at the Sessions-House in the Old-Baily, Friday the 12th of October 1660, before the Commissioners of Oyer and Terminer appointed by His Majesty for that purpose.
titleStmt.author: Scrope, Adrian, 1601-1660, defendant.
Carew, John, d. 1660, defendant.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Stafford and Edward Thomas,

notesStmt.note: Wing's imprint reads "Stetford" instead of Stafford.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
